Class IOUtil

    • net.automatalib.commons.util.IOUtil

extends Object
    Utility methods for operating with java.io.* classes.

    Malte Isberner

    • Method Detail

      • skip

        public static void skip(InputStream is)
                 throws IOException
        Skips the content of the stream as long as there is data available. Afterwards, the stream is closed.
        Parameters:
        is - the input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • copy

        public static void copy(InputStream is,
                        OutputStream os,
                        boolean close)
                 throws IOException
        Copies all data from the given input stream to the given output stream.
        Parameters:
        is - the input stream.
        os - the output stream.
        close - true if both streams are closed afterwards, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • copy

        public static void copy(InputStream is,
                        OutputStream os)
                 throws IOException
        Copies all data from the given input stream to the given output stream and closes the streams. Convenience method, same as copy(is, os, true).
        Parameters:
        is - the input stream.
        os - the output stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        copy(InputStream, OutputStream, boolean)

      • copy

                        Writer w,
                        boolean close)
                 throws IOException
        Copies all text from the given reader to the given writer.
        Parameters:
        r - the reader.
        w - the writer.
        close - true if both reader and writer are closed afterwards, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • copy

                        Writer w)
                 throws IOException

        Parameters:

        w - the writer.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:

      • asBufferedInputStream

        public static InputStream asBufferedInputStream(InputStream is)
        Ensures that the returned stream is a buffered version of the supplied input stream. The result must not necessarily be an instance of BufferedInputStream, it can also be, e.g., a ByteArrayInputStream, depending on the type of the supplied input stream.
        Parameters:
        is - the input stream
        Returns:
        a buffered version of is

      • asUncompressedInputStream

        public static InputStream asUncompressedInputStream(InputStream is)
                                             throws IOException
        Ensures that the returned stream is an uncompressed version of the supplied input stream.

        This method first tries to read the first two bytes from the stream, then resets the stream. If the first two bytes equal the GZip magic number (see GZIPInputStream.GZIP_MAGIC), the supplied stream is wrapped in a GZIPInputStream. Otherwise, the stream is returned as-is, but possibly in a buffered version (see asBufferedInputStream(InputStream)).

        Parameters:
        is - the input stream
        Returns:
        an uncompressed version of is
        Throws:
        IOException - if reading the magic number fails

        public static OutputStream asBufferedOutputStream(OutputStream os)
